Congratulations on completing the "Run Disney" 5K event and achieving a sub-35 minute finish time! That's a great accomplishment!

To help you improve your performance and increase your speed and endurance, here are some general tips:

1. **Incorporate interval training**: Intervals involve alternating between periods of high-intensity running and active recovery. This type of training can help you build speed and endurance. For example, try running at a fast pace for 1-2 minutes, followed by 2-3 minutes of easy jogging or walking. Repeat for 20-30 minutes.
2. **Increase your mileage gradually**: To improve endurance, you need to gradually increase your weekly mileage. Aim to increase your weekly mileage by no more than 10% each week to allow your body to adapt. This will help you build stamina and endurance.
3. **Incorporate strength training**: Building strength in your core, legs, and glutes can help you run more efficiently and improve your speed. Focus on exercises like squats, lunges, deadlifts, and leg press.
4. **Incorporate hill sprints**: Hill sprints involve running uphill at maximum effort for 30-90 seconds, followed by walking or jogging back down to recover. This type of training can help improve your explosive power and speed.
5. **Practice proper running form**: Good running form can help you run more efficiently and reduce your risk of injury. Focus on maintaining a tall posture, landing midfoot or forefoot, and keeping your arms relaxed.
6. **Incorporate longer runs**: While you're training for a 5K, it's essential to incorporate longer runs (6-8 kilometers) into your training schedule. This will help you build endurance and mental toughness.
7. **Focus on your breathing and pacing**: Practice deep, rhythmic breathing to help you stay relaxed and focused during your runs. Also, work on pacing yourself by starting at a comfortable pace and gradually increasing your speed as you get more comfortable.
8. **Incorporate flexibility and stretching exercises**: Incorporate exercises like leg swings, lunges, and calf raises to improve your flexibility and range of motion. This can help you maintain good form and reduce your risk of injury.
9. **Get enough rest and recovery**: Adequate rest and recovery are crucial for your body to adapt to the demands of running. Ensure you get 7-9 hours of sleep each night and take rest days as needed.
10. **Mix up your route and terrain**: Running on different routes and terrains can help keep your training interesting and prevent boredom. It can also help you build strength and endurance by challenging your body in different ways.

Remember, consistency and patience are key when it comes to improving your running performance. Stick to your training plan, listen to your body, and celebrate your progress along the way!

What's your goal for your next 5K event? Are you looking to beat your previous time or focus on enjoying the experience?
